name: webanno.custom.IGInstitutionalStatementRelationship

features.name: PrecedenceOrder
features.description: Indicates the precedence of multiple logically-combined statements. Lower values imply lower precedence.

features.name: LogicalRelationship

tag_set.name: IG Statement Relationships
tag_set.description: Horizontal, Vertical, or Component-level Nesting Relationships between Institutional Statements

tags.tag_description: AND combination of institutional statements on a given nesting level
Nested institutional statement contained within higher-level component.

Vertical relationship between monitored and consequential (regulatory punitive or incentivizing) statements. Requires annotation of statements as monitored or consequential. The target statement of the directed relationship is the consequential statement.
AND/OR combination of institutional statements on a given nesting level
EITHER/OR combination of institutional statements on a given nesting level

features.description: Indicates relationship type of institutional statement

description: Identifies logical relationships among institutional statement

features.name: ImplicitComponentReference
features.description: Captures reference to external component implicit in identified institutional statements Example: Policy advisers should inform the public and should highlight risks. The second statement could resolve to first statement's attribute.

features.name: ImplicitComponents
features.description: Identifies implicit component values inferred by the coder. List those as 'Component1: Value; Component2: Value' (e.g., 'Attribute: Actor; Deontic: must'). If a reference to other statements' components is possible, use 'External Component Reference' instead.

features.name: StatementRegulatoryPerspective

tag_set.name: IG Statement Perspective
tag_set.description: Indicates the perspective of an institutional statement emphasizing a regular statement (monitored), or a statement containing enforcement characteristics.

tags.tag_description:
Indicates a monitored statement. A monitored statement describes regulated statement content whose non-compliance is (potentially) sanctioned by another entity specified in a consequential statement.

Example: Citizen must comply (Statement 1), or else police officer must fine (Statement 2), or else authority must review police officer conduct (Statement 3).
Statement 1 is exclusively monitored (it does not contain any sanctioning component); Statement 2 is both monitored as well as consequential (it describes both a regulated action as well as sanctions for another actor's actions); Statement 3 is consequential only (no further oversight is specified).

Indicates a consequential statement. A consequential statement specifies consequences (e.g., sanctions) for non-compliance with the statement it monitors (monitored statement). 

Example: Citizen must comply (Statement 1), or else police officer must fine (Statement 2), or else authority must review police officer conduct (Statement 3).
Statement 1 is exclusively monitored (it does not contain any sanctioning component); Statement 2 is both monitored as well as consequential (it describes both a regulated action as well as sanctions for another actor's actions); Statement 3 is consequential only (no further oversight is specified).

Indicates a statement that is both monitored and consequential at the same time. A statement can both be monitored and consequential if capturing behaviour enforced as specified in a nested or related institutional statement, and describing regulatory-punitive or -incentivizing behaviour for a statement it monitors.

Example: Citizen must comply (Statement 1), or else police officer must fine (Statement 2), or else authority must review police officer conduct (Statement 3).
Statement 1 is exclusively monitored (it does not contain any sanctioning component); Statement 2 is both monitored as well as consequential (it describes both a regulated action as well as sanctions for another actor's actions); Statement 3 is consequential only (no further oversight is specified).

features.description: Indicates whether a statement describes regulated content (monitored statement), or consequences for non-compliance (consequential statement), or both.

features.name: RuleType

tag_set.name: IG Rule Type
tag_set.description: Indicates rule type of institutional statement

tags.tag_description: Rule indicating the number and nature of participants involved in a given operational- or collective-choice decision
Rule defining a) eligibility to hold positions, b) the process of assignment, and c) the exit rule(s) (rules for leaving the position)
Rule prescribing or constraining action choice in action situation
Rule specifying information channels, along with associated obligations, permissions and prohibitions
Rule specifying reward or sanctions for particular actions (e.g., based on chosen action or outcome)
Rule creating positions that actors may hold in the action situation
Rule delimiting the range of possible outcomes

features.description: Indicates the rule type of the institutional statement.

features.name: StatementLevel

tag_set.name: IG Statement Level
tag_set.description: Indicates the level at which the institutional statement operates

tags.tag_description: Action and outcomes related to on-the-ground rules
Level at which operational level statements are created by means of collective action
Level at which statements are created for use on the collective action level
Level at which statements for constitutional level are created

features.description: Indicates the statement's rule type as either operational, collective action, constitutional or meta-constitutional.
features.traits: {"multipleRows":false,"collapsedRows":1,"expandedRows":1,"keyBindings":[{"keyCombo":"1","value":"1 - Operational Level"},{"keyCombo":"2","value":"2 - Collection Action Level"},{"keyCombo":"3","value":"3 - Constitutional Level"},{"keyCombo":"4","value":"4 - Meta-Constitutional Level"}]}

features.name: Statementtype

tags.tag_description: Indicates constitutive statement
Indicates a regulatory statement

features.description: Indicates statement type as either constitutive or regulatory.
